intro: Geum elatum var. humile, commonly known as the dwarf garden buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features upright stems with palmately divided, bright green leaves that are finely toothed. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
